com.intland.codebeamer.manager

Class ArtifactApprovalManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.dao.support.DaoSupport

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.intland.codebeamer.license.LicenseAware, EntityManager, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    public class ArtifactApprovalManager
extends AbstractEntityManagerImpl
implements com.intland.codebeamer.license.LicenseAware
    Business Layer artifact approval management.

      • deleteArtifactApprovalWorkflow

        public boolean deleteArtifactApprovalWorkflow(UserDto user,
                                     java.lang.Integer artifactApprovalWorkflowId)
        Delete an approval workflow. Also automatically publishes all changes which were pending in the workflow but has not been rejected yet. The already artifacts which were already rejected will be "rolled-back" in the sense that their original content will have been published back.
        Parameters:
        user -
        artifactApprovalWorkflowId - The id of the workflow to be deleted.
        Returns:
        If the approval workflow was successfully deleted

      • createArtifactApprovalStep

      • updateArtifactApprovalSteps

        public void updateArtifactApprovalSteps(UserDto user,
                               java.util.List<ArtifactApprovalStepDto> changed)
        Save the changes in the update ArtifactApprovalSteps -like reordering- in one transaction. Note: the transaction is necessary, because we swap the ordinals of ArtifactApprovalSteps, and the ordinal number is required to be unique, so when saving a step with an other steps' ordinal number the db would throw an constraint exception.
        Parameters:
        user -
        changed -

      • findApprovalStateByArtifact

        public java.util.List<ArtifactApprovalHistoryEntryDto> findApprovalStateByArtifact(UserDto user,
                                                                          ArtifactDto artifact)
        Returns the current state of the approval workflow for the artifact, empty if there is no approval workflow applied to the artifact. Meaning of current state: the initial step is the first item in the list, and the list contains all steps even if they were not reached yet.

      • isApprovalWorkflowApplied

                              java.lang.Integer artifactApprovalWorkflowId)

      • findArtifactsByApprovalWorkflowApplied

        public java.util.List<ArtifactDto> findArtifactsByApprovalWorkflowApplied(UserDto user,
                                                                 java.lang.Integer artifactApprovalWorkflowId,
                                                                 ArtifactApprovalManager.ModificationOrder order)
        Returns the artifacts this approval workflow is applied to.
        Parameters:
        user -
        artifactApprovalWorkflowId -
        order - The order for the history entries, if null then the NEWEST_FIRST is the default

      • findArtifactsByActiveApprovalWorkflows

        public java.util.List<ArtifactDto> findArtifactsByActiveApprovalWorkflows(UserDto user,
                                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> artifactApprovalWorkflowIds,
                                                                 ArtifactApprovalManager.ModificationOrder order)
        Find the artifacts which belong to the given approval workflows, and only if the workflow is active on them. This is: - they have the given workflow - they have (non-empty) a pending revision - they are not at (before) the first step of the workflow
        Parameters:
        artifactApprovalWorkflowIds - The ids of approval-workflows
        order - The order for the history entries, if null then the NEWEST_FIRST is the default
        Returns:
        List of artifacts with the approval workflow instance bound

      • findApprovalHistoryByArtifact

        public java.util.List<ArtifactApprovalHistoryEntryDto> findApprovalHistoryByArtifact(UserDto user,
                                                                            java.lang.Integer artifactId)
        Returns the artifact approval history records for the given artifact, or null if the user has no access to it.

                                                              java.lang.Integer approvalWorkflowId)
        Returns all participants of the approval workflow, that means the union of the approvers of each step.

      • findPotentialApproversByApprovalStep

        public java.util.Set<UserDto> findPotentialApproversByApprovalStep(UserDto user,
                                                          java.lang.Integer approvalStepId)
        Returns the users who are authorized to approve or reject a step. (Approvals can be based on roles or individual user accounts, but this method will resolve roles to user accounts.)

                                           java.lang.Integer approvalStepId)
        Get all users involved in the specified step and the following one (if exists)
        Parameters:
        user - is the current user
        approvalStepId - is the current step
        Returns:
        the users who are authorized to approve or reject the current (and/or the following) step.

      • approveArtifactRevision

        public boolean approveArtifactRevision(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                              UserDto user,
                              java.lang.Integer artifactId,
                              java.lang.Integer artifactApprovalStepId,
                              java.lang.Integer revision,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              boolean approving)
                                throws ChangeVetoedException
        Approves or rejects an artifact revision.
        Parameters:
        approving - whether to approve (true) or reject (false) the latest revision.
        Returns:
        whether the approval was successful.
        Throws:
        ChangeVetoedException - if the approval was rejected by some listener.

        See: isArtifactEditableInApproval(UserDto, ArtifactDto, Integer)

      • isArtifactEditableInApproval

        public boolean isArtifactEditableInApproval(UserDto user,
                                   ArtifactDto artifact,
                                   java.lang.Integer revision)
        Check if the artifact in approval-process, then if it is editable by the user. The artifact will be editable if: - it is the latest revision available - the user is participating in the workflow (at least approver in one of the steps).
        Parameters:
        user - that wants to edit the artifact revision
        artifact - The artifact to check
        revision - The revision requested
        Returns:
        true If the approval is not preventing the artifact being edited

      • isArtifactViewableInApproval

      • canRejectDocumentInWorkflow

        public boolean canRejectDocumentInWorkflow(UserDto user,
                                  ArtifactDto artifact)
        Returns if the user can reject the document in workflow. Differs from the canApproveWorkflow() that the "author" of the last change will always be able to reject the document in approval.

      • restartWorkflowOnActiveArtifactsInApproval

        public void restartWorkflowOnActiveArtifactsInApproval(UserDto user,
                                              ArtifactApprovalWorkflowDto approvalWorkflow)
        Restart the workflow on all Artifacts which are active in the given workflow back to the beginning of the workflow. So after this call the workflow becomes editable, because nobody uses it.
        Parameters:
        user -
        approvalWorkflow - The approval workflow

      • findPendingApprovals

        public java.util.List<ArtifactApprovalHistoryEntryDto> findPendingApprovals(UserDto currentUser,
                                                                   UserDto user,
                                                                   java.lang.Integer projectId,
                                                                   java.lang.Integer limit,
                                                                   ArtifactApprovalManager.ModificationOrder modificationOrder)
        Find the pending approvals for the user. These are the approvals which are: - not yet finished - not yet approved - in a "step"/state which can be approved by the user.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the user executing this search
        user - The user to search for whose pending approvals will be returned
        projectId - Optional id filter for project. If null provided then all projects are returned.
        limit - The maximum number of entries returned. If null, then all will be returned.
        modificationOrder - The order for the history entries by the last-content modified date
        Returns:
        List of ArtifactApprovalHistoryEntryDtos which are not really historical entries, but contain the current state of the Approval. Ordered by last modification of artifact descending.

      • findMyArtifactsInApproval

        public java.util.Map<ArtifactDto,ArtifactApprovalHistoryEntryDto> findMyArtifactsInApproval(UserDto user,
                                                                                   java.lang.Integer projectId,
                                                                                   java.lang.Integer numEntities,
                                                                                   ArtifactApprovalManager.ModificationOrder modificationOrder)
        Find those artifacts with their current approval state, where the given user is modified the artifact, and the artifact is waiting for some pending approval. The method returns a Map where the user's artifacts are the keys, and the value is full state-flow of the approval, including the 'future' steps, same steps as the findApprovalStateByArtifact(UserDto, ArtifactDto) method's result.
        Parameters:
        user - The user who modified the approval
        projectId - Optional project-id parameter to show only artifacts in this project. If null then all projects will match.
        numEntities - Maximum number of entities returned.
        modificationOrder - The order for the history entries, can be null, then NEWEST_FIRST is the default
        Returns:
        Map contains artifacts as keys and the pending state for the artifact.
